title: Power play: At night, O Panneerselvam seizes the day | Chennai News - Times of India

organizations.name: chennai news - times of india chennai

text:
CHENNAI: Tuesday in Chennai started with some high decibel dissent against AIADMK general secretary V K Sasikala by senior leader P H Pandian, but what stole the thunder was caretaker chief minister O Panneerselvam 's 40-minute silence at Jayalalithaa's resting place on the Marina beach. Finally, when OPS opened his eyes - and mouth - Sasikala's power play appeared to have gone horribly wrong. 

It was a usual Tuesday evening on the Marina. Beachgoers, couples, evening walkers and vendors - all were lazing around by the bay in the balmy breeze till the hum was broken by O Panneerselvam's entry. Amid the confusion over V K Sasikala's swearing-in ceremony, the governor's absence from Chennai, O Pannerselvam, known as the man who had hitherto taken orders, seized the day by the night. 

After sitting for more than 40 minutes next to Jayalalithaa's memorial, OPS opened his eyes and started wiping his tears. The eerie silence was broken by questions from reporters and pleas from security personnel to keep calm. He remained patient till reporters settled down. OPS spoke in an emotion-filled voice. "I was forced to resign," he said, and went on to name his colleagues who pulled the rug from under his feet. After dropping a bombshell at the dead night, he left for his residence making his cabinet colleagues fend for themselves.
